Text: "Concrete is a block created when concrete powder touches water. It comes in the sixteen dye colors."
"Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations."
"A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi
column4: primarily used as a building block and to create planks
column5: a versatile crafting ingredient. There are currently ten types of logs: oak

Text: "The ocean is an aquatic biome consisting of water. Oceans are the largest biome by area
column4: covering anywhere around 28-29% of the surface area of the Overworld when factoring in all of its varieties and consist of a deep water source with the surface at an altitude of Y=62 by default
column5: which is counted as the “sea level” layer of the world."

column4: commonly referred to as mushroom islands
column5: are rare biomes which almost always generate as islands surrounded by deep oceans. They are the only place in the game where mycelium and mooshrooms are found
column6: and have the special property that no hostile mobs normally spawn in them."

Text: "Speed is a status effect that increases an entity's walking speed by 20% multiplied by the effect level. It expands a player's field of view (FOV) accordingly. Negative levels decrease speed
"An ancient city is a palatial structure found in deep dark biomes at layer -51
column4: harboring chests containing some items that cannot be found anywhere else. It is also the largest structure in the game."
